page.title: 08DEANSTON VILLAGERS
page.content: Deanston villagers lifestyle has been influenced over the years by the Mill and Distillery, the village having been built for Mill workers. A small industrial community was thus formed in the middle of a rural area. Although this industrial populace has merged with the rural one through inter-marriages it has maintained an industrial identity, even after the closure of the Mill and decline of the Distillery. Most working people now travel to the larger towns for jobs.The once thriving social life based on the Mill Social Club has now ceased. The nearby hotel has closed, as have the Caravan Park and the Bowling Green. The Primary School is now the 'hub' of the village and is used for the children's club, church services and any other meetings in our one shop cum Post Office community.
